title: Latest update removes location assist. Why?
body: App was fine and used it often. Then while on vacation I needed to find where the valet put my car so I could fetch something. Wouldn’t you know it, the app updated itself over Wi-Fi. Says for app improvements and bug fixes?  No. They removed the location assistance map. They realize with 3G going away and their not updating the chips in the 2012-2018 cars, that sneakily removing the function from the app may stop some people asking questions once the service is shut down. Just like when they force updated the car OS and removed the ability to zoom into the weather map. Who did that really hurt to keep that function in? Attempts to contact Lexus runs you through loops of circular contacts that get you nowhere. Maybe if enough people make a big enough noise, they will then listen. If you are unaware, when 3G goes away, the cars that use 3G will lose most of their safety functions which we paid for. Like SOS, location assist, anything this app does like check if your car was broken into or your trunk was opened. The ability to remote start the car on a hot day. All gone. The chip is in a small computer deep in the dash that they don’t want to replace. It could be but they just figured they would leave you to the big surprise one day. Audi and BMW took care of their customers by upgrading their chips to 4G. Are we not good enough? And yes, many 4 year old 2018 cars will get the shaft as well. Expect your resale value to drop once people get wind that the ability to call or be called by SOS if in an accident doesn’t work. Way to save those pennies Lexus!

This app on more than one occasion has told me that it was unable to process my request while trying to start my vehicle only to go outside and find my car was running at other times it didn’t process my request I never started the car. For $85 I should be able to use the app to roll down and up my windows as well as open and close my sunroof some key fobs do that already for free. So if we’re going to charge a premium price because it’s a luxury brand then give your customers something to smile about. I would like to be able to say yeah cost me $85 a year but I can do all this with my app. hopefully someone will read this and say you know this customer has a point instead of reading it and saying yeah right good luck with that. Well I know this looks long but it’s a quick read and I hope someone reads it.  I’m two years in and it’s a waste of money.  thank you

title: This App does not function on iphone 6 plus
body:
I am running 12.5.3 on my iPhone 6 Plus

The Lexus app does not work on my iPhone and I am unable to contact my 2018 ES 350 to view its status, start the engine, etc.

On trying to open the app I get a message that says 

“New Version Available

There is a new app version available requiring use of iOS 12 and watch OS 5.0 or later. Please update to the latest version to continue.”

On clicking ‘Update Now’ I get to the App Store where I am told that the app requires iOS 13.0 or later.

Clicking on the update button the following message appears ....

“Download an older version of this app?

The current version requires iOS 13.0 or later, but you can download the last compatible version.”

On clicking the download button one gets a repeat of the above message and one is locked into a loop from which there is no escape.

I have tried deleting the app from my iPhone and restoring it from the App Store but the same problem simply returns. 

I am now left with no other option but to have my subscription cancelled until you provide an app than can continue to run on an iPhone 6 Plus with its software fully up to date.

title: Terrible app!!!  Doesn’t work at all.
body:
I just bought my 2021 Lexus and was told by the sales guy to download the app then he gave me a number to call to activate it.  

I have done everything and the app doesn’t even let me log in.  Once I do, it just acts like it will open but goes right back to the login screen. 

So frustrating!  I had the Toyota app previously and had ZERO issues. I don’t know what the problem is.   You would think that when you pay the $$$ we do for the vehicle that a simple app should work. 

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!

title: Won’t work
body: App won’t allow me to setup/login keeps refreshing please fix!!!!

title: Can’t use
body: I downloaded the Lexus suite app and that is working. Now I’ve tried this app and I can’t login. It tells me to use same login as suite app, but sends me back to register. I try to register and it tells me email and number already have an account.

title: Destination navi capability
body: Please add the popular (everywhere else) remote function for punching in a destination on the OEM phone app, which then sends the destination data directly to the car. This is a nearly universal ability of other OEMs and a rather shocking omission here. Thank you.

title: Don’t buy remote service
body:
The remote service doesn’t do what it advertises.
45 seconds to lock
45 seconds to unlock
No climate control regulation, you get the temperature you left with your last trip. 
Car only idles for 10 minutes and shots off.  You need to restart it again to do another 10. And it takes 1 minute to start it.
When you walk to your car idling and open the door- the engine dies.
Unsubscribe and call Lexus USA for a refund

title: Latest update
body: The last update on the App 1.1.1 has made it not work at all. Will not start any more. Fix this Lexus.

title: It’s disappointing to have Lexus waste my time in this way
body:
I have a 2012 CT 200. For iOS reasons, somewhere around 14, maps stopped working with Hands Free. I was curious what other options I had and found this app. As of this writing, my car is almost a decade old. But I do have a multimedia system that has been updated by satellite in the past. It is Bluetooth compatible. So I figured it was worth a shot.I put in my VIN number to register. The app asks if I’m sure I’m using the right VIN number. It cannot register me. I try again.  This time I scan the VIN number using the app. Again, it asks me to check the VIN number and tells me if I keep seeing this message to reach out contact Lexus. A very general call-to-action that the app in no way facilitates. (By say, providing a phone number.) So I googled contact Lexus. I find a number and begin the button pushing trying to get something close to “Help me with the app, please.” One of the prompts mentions Enform, so I select that. I get a woman who sounds like she’s having a bad day. It happens. I explain to her what’s going on. She asked for my VIN number. I open the app and read it to her. From that, she’s able to correctly identify my car, so it’s definitely the correct VIN number. I explain to her that I’m just trying to register the app so I can see what’s available. She explains to me that I will have to “enroll” so I can be told what services are available to my car, if any.  Why isn’t this something the app can do in far less time than I’ve spent on this whole process? Like, 10 seconds? Good question.This is beginning to feel like a huge waste of time, but I’m stubborn. This woman tells me she will have to transfer me to someone else who can enroll me, so that I can find out if this app is of any use to me at all. Why this woman who had my VIN number and knew what model/year of car I have couldn’t tell me herself, I don’t know. So she “transfers” me and the line, predictably enough from her tone,  goes dead. For a Kia owner, probably an average experience. From a Lexus perspective, one star seems like too much. But that’s my experience with an app. The end.

EDIT: Just wanted to update that I got an e-Mail with a version of the same, meaningless response most frustrated folks have gotten here.The responses seem like the app itself. Unhelpful and thus an unnecessary waste of everyone’s time. 

Lexus Social Team, you know we can see all these responses, right? It’s not flattering or validating to get a version of the same cut and paste you’re giving everybody else. Just ignoring the feedback, which for all practical purposes appears to be what’s happening, would be less insulting.

title: Worst App ever
body:
When I downloaded it to register my car there was someone else’s car, name , address under my email and mobile number. It’s almost a week and no one seems to know how to fix it. It’s not even a Lexus. No one can explain why this is happening.  Beware if you Dow load this horrible app.

To the developers- I have contacted you several times and was told we are looking into it. I also contacted Lexus and they didn’t know how to help either. I have wasted too many hours on this. No one ever  called me back or contacted me. The last time I called I was nastily told -“when we are able to fix it we will call you”. Never happened.

title: Good Functionality, but ignores privacy preferences
body:
I like the functionality of the app, but that comes with one big HOWEVER and it is the reason I cannot give a higher rating. 

When creating a new account, I attempted to simply create one with Apple ID. I do this for both ease of use and privacy purposes as the Apple ID function allows you to hide your email in favor of a proxy address. 

When you attempt to do this in the Lexus app, it refuses to allow you to proceed unless you allow them to see your actual email instead of the Apple proxy email. For this reason, I have to give it a low rating.

title: Expected more from Lexus
body: This app has a lot of features but the log in is a pain. Every time I get on I can’t make it remember my password I can’t make it use Face ID. Logging in is so difficult to remember passwords and stuff I don’t even use the app much. Also everything takes super long to work after you click it.

title: Total garbage of an app and infotainment system.
body: For a $64k car I expected way better. App works about as well as the vehicle "infotainment" system, which is not very well at all. Clearly Toyota Motor Corp/Lexus didn't read the customer reviews on the first few versions of the app otherwise they might have made some improvements. So much potential for technology integration with mobile devices and improved vehicle interface experiences yet Toyota still continues to disappoint customers. It was sad to see that from 2010 to 2020 in almost a decade nothing significantly changed in the vehicle and now the app is another representation of the lack of attention to customer feedback.

title: Love this app
body: Works flawlessly, great design, great features, absolutely love this app.

title: Same crippled functionality for over a decade!
body: It’s shameful that functionality remains so crippled for an expensive so called Luxury brand. It’s 2021 not the 1980’s we should be able to control and activate AC/HEAT and other functions via the app. I’m sure the vehicles have this capability but you limit the app most likely for legal reasons, you are more concerned about legal issues then you are about functionality.  The subscription is overpriced for the poor functionality that it offers which is the main reason I won’t pay for this. Even low end non luxury brands like Kia offer this functionality as do most all other manufacturers, shame on you!

title: Awful
body: Honestly, the app is so slow its really not even worth the download. In comparison to any other car app, this is extremely slow and disappointing. I have a freaking 2020 Lexus and the technology has advanced so thoroughly that it was almost shocking that they did not have any kind of accessibility in terms of unlocking the car, starting the car, and locking the car. There are literally no other features besides those ones. It’s only purpose is the LEXUS manual bc my dumb Lexus dealership did not provide me a paper book of the manual!!!!!! I am just upset with a capital D for Disappointed 👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽

title: It works...sort of.
body:
Bought a 2020 Certified ES 350. Remote Services would not work. I’ve had the car back to the dealer twice. All the other information does show on the app but the remote start/lock/unlock still will not work. When I try any of these functions I receive the message “Request could not be completed. Contact dealer your dealer for assistance.”
I’ve called the dealer(again) & their IT specialist told me he has contacted Lexus & will let me know what they will do.

title: Somewhat functional
body:
The app is ok for updates on mileage, alerts, remote start. However the lock and unlock buttons do not work (yes... reloaded etc.). It tells you to tap and hold but when you do- Nothing. 
So make sure everything is set before you leave your vehicle or else you’ll get alerts you can’t remote fix as advertised 😩.

title: Non responsive
body: Non responsive- app does not work. Unable to connect my ES350.

title: Login
body: Shouldn’t have to keep logging in.

title: Pathetic!
body: How are you forcing me to update while I’m in an emergency?

title: Servers still down
body: I have been trying to connect my car but after inputting the vin it says.”system server error”

title: Non-functional app
body: I locked myself out of the house but had an appointment to get to, so I tried using the remote start function to no avail. It keeps trying to connect but nothing happens. I have full service, so I know that’s not it. Very disappointing given the brand and reliability that comes with the name.

title: Updates Always Lose Login Info
body: The app has pretty good features, but these don’t matter if after every time you download an update the app loses your login information. And it is condescending to imply that this is for my security — my banking apps have no trouble preserving and accessing my credentials after their updates are installed!

title: Useless
body: Every time I sign in it will return to a slightly different page asking if I want to register or sign in. And around in circles it goes. It’s let me past the register/ sign in pages a whopping one time.

title: it's not what i thought
body: I would like to say that it is the worst but I could not because some things work.  One of the things that do not work correctly is the location, right now I would like to see where I left the car parked and it only shows the location of two days ago, I think they should update that, suggest for the developers a track of the movements made in miles and  consumption and things like other competitors like Jaguar, a suggestion !!!  In general they should work more on the app

title: Terrible User Experience
body: Terrible user experience.  Any time I want to change any setting, it takes a long time to respond.  When I tried to add my wife thru the Family driver setting, I could not change any of the parameters.  When my wife tried to add the VIN to her phone, it just kept telling server error, after days of trying.  I can’t imagine this is the best Lexus can come up with.  You guys really need to do better.

title: Mscheffler
body: Have read reviews about remote services not working with the Lexus enforcement app. I too am having this problem. I even had a new DCM replaced and still not working. Am back to the service department again. Even with recent update still did not work. Extremely frustrating to have a car with all the technology capabilities and you cannot use them. Please fix this issue!

title: A Spy App!
body:
This app spies on every second of you using the car, it knows where you are, how fast you were driving and it sends it to Lexus. 
But if you want to use remote start feature you’ll have to accept the invasion of your privacy. 👎🏻

title: Simply awful
body: Just bought a used Lexus and decided to give this app a try. Registration did not take despite email and text verification of account. If I could give this app below a single star I’d do it. Stellar vehicles, useless app

title: Login, login, login, login!
body: I am writing this on behalf of my mother. Every few days I have to log back into this app. Now it doesn’t seem like a big deal but it is when your mom has no experience with apps and computers and she wakes you up at 6AM every so often to re-login. Please fix this! We’re seriously contemplating getting a separate car starter because the app is so bad!

title: Works 2 of 5 times
body: Constantly being disconnected and needing user login info. Will prompt to call Lexus when entered vin is scanned from vehicle barcode. This app is useless, better off using the key fob to start the vehicle.

title: Would be a good app if login not reset all the time
body: Not a bad app in general but whenever I need to use it my login info is gone and I have to look it up. Not even my banking apps (which are secure) do this to me

title: Never works
body: I Try to connect my car to my phone and it always says that my account has a wrong wrong Vin# or Wrong City.

title: Needs a widget
body: This app works pretty well. Would definitely rate it 5 stars if it had a proper home screen widget.

title: Old notifications unable to delete
body:
App is fine except that there’s no way to delete old notifications. I have about 60
Notifications from 2 months ago and it’s sitting there unable to delete. Very poorly created app for a luxury automobile like Lexus. Insulting.

title: So slow
body: This is the worst remote start app I’ve ever had. It takes forever to start and it only goes for ten minutes x2, then it disables. The most frustrating part is how long it takes to connect to the car to start it. It’s slightly ridiculous.

title: Red Apple
body: Since I can’t download the update to my older iPhone what options do I have?

title: Developers need to do a better job
body: The developers need to do a better job of maintaining user’s data when the app updates.  AND stop logging me out of the app.  I have to jump through a few hoops to look my passwords up before I can use the app.  And this issue always seems to occur at the least convenient moment.

title: App doesn’t work! Wrong VIN error
body: Constantly getting the error that my information is incorrect once I put the vin in. So frustrating!!

title: Gets the job done, but only just
body: I’ll start by saying that I love what this app lets you do! It’s great to be able to start my car so it can warm up, make sure it’s locked, etc. However, it’s just incredibly slow to catch up if you haven’t opened it in the last 10 minutes, for example to make sure the doors are locked. Also, no matter how many times I select “keep me signed in” and “use Face ID,” it doesn’t work and I constantly have to resign in, including getting the code sent to my phone. This really chips away at the intended convenience. When I’m getting ready to head out somewhere, I have to consciously set aside about 2 minutes to log into the app, which is pretty much the opposite of what I want to be doing. Still, when it’s really cold, it’s nice to look forward to getting into a warm car. Maybe one day we’ll even be able to adjust the temperature from the app too!

title: Remote start is a joke.
body:
When I needed the remote to work in the coldest of the year, it failed miserably. I had to go out and started it and come back in the house to wait for my car to warm up. Defeating the purpose of remote starting.  
If I don’t use my car for two days or more, again it won’t start I had to manually start it. 
This is an ongoing problem.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app time and time again to no fixed.  The login is a pain too. Although I have it set to keep me logged in it continues to logged me out.  I think I am ready to go back to regular remote started control. No sense on paying for services I can’t use.

title: Not a good app
body: It keeps asking me to sign in almost every day.  That means you have to put in email and password all over again. Not recommend this app.  No use!

title: very unhappy remote status - start not reliable
body: Very unhappy - remote status, parking location, remote start not reliable. I don’t know if it’s the app or the vehicle but my 2020 UX with remote start keeps not working - remote status and functions stop and the app can’t connect with the vehicle. I’ve taken the car to the dealer no solution other than to cold boot the vehicle by manually disconnecting the vehicle’s battery. Then it works again for weeks sometimes months but stops without warning. Vehicle is beautifully designed mechanically but the remote software is disappointing! And I don’t learn the remote functioning has stopped and app does not have current parking location until I try to use it! So I can’t count on it and in the city where parking often is in a nee place means I can get truly stuck. I would expect better car has strong cell signal not a cellular communication issue for in-vehicle cellular.

title: It takes 6 hours to get txt/sms messages.
body: Can’t use the app

title: Junk
body: This app rarely works. Constantly logs you out even with the checked box to keep you logged in. Currently trying to log in and keep getting booted back to log in screen every time login/password is entered. Complete junk.

title: Keeps signing me out
body: Face ID won’t work. Keeps signing me out. Won’t send access code. Tried deleting and reinstalling. Won’t bother with it anymore.

title: Me
body: Why does it now take 30 minutes or longer for my activation code text to arrive. By then I do not need a remote start. Again this always seem to happen on the coldest mornings, therefore useless.

title: Horrible after recent update!
body: App was working fine until I downloaded the most recent update two days ago. Since then I haven’t been able to get back into the app. I keep putting my phone number in and it’s supposed to text a verification code. Lexus never sends one until 4-6 hours later. Every time I go to enter the code I’ve received, 4 hours later, into the app it tells me that my session has timed out! This has been going on for two days now. I’ve tried deleting and redownloading, tried resetting my password but guess what... in order to do so you have to be sent a verification code. And of course the cycle starts all over again. I don’t get a code for 4-6 hours, once I enter the code Lexus finally sends, it tells me it’s wrong and the session has timed out. If you haven’t downloaded the update... DON’T DO IT! You won’t be able to log back in. This is just downright ridiculous.

title: Okay app
body: app is slowly improving with each update. I wish there are some new feature down the road like ability to lower windows or tilt sunroof . It will come handy in hot weather to evacuate hot air.

title: Seeing improvement...however
body: My car is a 2016 IS. Haven’t had any issues for the last 6-8 Months. Even after new updates. However, I still don’t think it’s worth $16 for remote services.

title: Can’t even log in
body: I have a Lexus Drivers account that works perfectly fine on a desktop online but can’t log in through this app. Keep getting a pop up that says “The vehicle information you entered does not match our records” after inputting the VIN.

title: It’s ok
body: Latest version doesn’t integrate well with password managers for login id.  When the app seems to be down it just asks you to add a VIN with no easy way to check what status their systems are in leaving you to clueless as to what happened and when the system may return.

title: 3rd class app for a 1st class car
body: Doesn’t work with Siri. App is slow and you have to actually be in the app for longer than you should be. Locking/unlocking & starting my car should be as quick and easy and it is with my key fob. Simplicity should win and this service definitely loses. Won’t renew my subscription and can’t believe I paid almost $100 for something I don’t love as much as the rest of my car.

title: You really should include remote start on luxury vehicles
body: This is a nice app, with nice services, however what I’m truly disappointed about is the fact that you pay several thousands of dollars for a vehicle that had remote start as a capability, but Lexus revoked that from you after a certain time and you need to pay to use these features again. I bought a pre owned 2017 Lexus IS 200t, and I love everything about my vehicle! I just figured out that in order to remote start my car I have to pay for a subscription, that’s just unfair to me and really a lie to make more money off of others, Lexus you’re already charging people a lot of money, as you should for a luxury vehicle, at least allow them to remote start their car from the key fob.

title: Remote services glitch
body: There’s a fault in your app when I start my NX through this app, the app keeps spinning the start engine option, it doesn’t allow me to click the start engine feature Bc it is stuck in a spinning mode ... I have to force close the app Everytime I need to start my car ... pls fix this

title: Disappointed
body: The Lexus app is a great idea unfortunately they can NOT execute.Have had issues in the transition from Enform- it didn’t recognize my vehicle- after multiple calls with support it finally linked. Now that it is cold n a perfect opportunity to use the remote start but the system would not connect. After trying for a few days it still will not function-Lexus tech- worthless.

title: App is Terrible
body: I have a 2017 GS350.  I have had countless issues with this app.  Randomly locks up and stops working.  Tells me to contact my dealer.  Completely useless.

title: Miss the Old Trip list
body: I like this app it’s intuitive. However, I really miss the old apps ability to view the trip, i.e. where did it start and where it ended. I also miss being able to access the history of those trips. The drivers score really doesn’t do anything for me other than insult me LOL. Please bring the trip feature back into this new app.

title: Mostly non-functional app
body: This U.S. app is supposed to only start, lock and unlock the car ... pretty simple. But 60% of the time it doesn’t work. And it does not work in Canada. Hyundai has a better remote start where one can set the temp inside and it doesn’t stop when the doors are opened. I’ve been a Lexus driver for nearly 20 years ... this app alone could make me explore other makes next time.

title: Non performing expensive app with unresponsive support
body: In moving to this updated app - it has not worked to remote start my car - I primarily only use in winter but have not been able to use at all - it just won’t work.  In calling the app support I’ve had multiple run arounds - have called seven times and been on hold from 30-75 minutes.  I w call numbers provided and then am told I need to call another number which is usually the number I already called.  Further frustrating is the menu to select where your call goes to is long and confusing so ea h time you have to muddle through that.  As of two weeks later, approx 8 calls, and hours on this - nobody can tell me anything and looks like no motivation to fix the issue.  I have four Lexus cars in the family and the service with this app is appalling and not worth it.

title: Worst app ever!
body:
LEXUS apps are the worst. This one logs me out every.single.time I’ve ever tried to use it. Face ID is good enough for everyone else but Lexus, it never works.
Not worth looking at my password,  then risking having to change or reset it, just to turn your car on. Though that would be great, now that it’s freezing here!
In fact, all of their technology is horrible. Brand new 2020 and the apps don’t work, the wifi has never worked (except for 1 hour at the dealership!), AppleCar play usb constantly switches off while I’m driving, turned off Lexus+Alexa migration day 1 it was so bad.  It’s a good thing the car is nice, I can’t wait for my lease to be up! So disappointed in LEXUS.

title: Terrible
body: The app only works about 70% of the time.  Which doesn’t sound so bad except you have to PAY for this service.  GM vehicles get this same service for FREE!! If I’m paying for a service I expect it to be top of the line.  At the time of writing this it is -13 degrees outside... yes you read that right NEGATIVE, and I keep getting an error response from this horrible app. Would not pay for this again!

title: Enform app suite not working
body: I can’t connect to enform app suite in my NX300

title: Non-functional
body:
Update 02/08/2020. 
The app still is non-functional. Last time the app communicated with the car was September 27, 2020. Re-installed the app and still no change. 

This app is non-functional. None of the features work for locking, unlocking, and remote starting of the vehicle. It continuously fails to connect to the vehicle. In addition, it does not update the status of the vehicle for extended periods of time. One might think the car is locked only to find out that the status of the vehicle is several hours to a day old. Refreshing the status will not change that either.

title: Lexus technology is and has been terrible
body: If only their car quality was used in their app technology.  Bad decisions, poor design.  But, only option is to drive another brand.

title: Long response time and lots of errors
body:
Very long response time. Sometimes gives an error messages that vehicle cannot be started but it is not. Shows wrong vehicle status that trunk or moon roof are not locked. 
With last update it stopped to ask for password or Face ID, which I think is not right, because if I lost my phone, somebody can use to open my car.  Also, if you have 2 lexus cars in one account, the app won’t work on 2 apple watches. Unable to setup default car for 2 devices, only for account...

title: Really inconsistent
body: The app times out 4 out of 5 times when requesting the car to start. Just doesn’t work.

title: Can’t sign in
body: It doesn’t let me sign in on my phone. I pay monthly for nothing.

title: Slow, often crashes
body: This app is just awful. I have had a Lexus vehicle for 5 years and several versions of this, all bad. Even today I can’t even log in because when I click “log in” the app blinks but does nothing. This type of stuff happens all the time. I don’t understand how a luxury vehicle company makes people pay for this type of functionality. If the car itself wasn’t amazing I would ditch the brand on this annoyance alone.

title: Get constantly logged out
body: App logs me out all the time, sometimes I am not able to log back in. When I try to log in with my email and password, app brings me back to the Sign in screen. Even though I have Face ID enabled, app asks me to sign in using login and password - super inconvenient!!

title: App not working
body: App stopped connecting to my car for a few weeks. Can’t start the car using the app. Called to help fix the issue, nothing. Told me to take it to the dealership? Lucky I don’t pay for subscription, it’s free through my 3 year lease. When the app did work I loved it.

title: Registration is a pain
body:
Just bought an RX 450h. Even the simple process of registering for a new account is so difficult. I can’t remember an app where I couldn’t even get registered. You need to fire the people who created this app.

The app rejected my phone number. It rejected the strong password created by my iPhone. It even rejected the code that the app sent to my email. Can there be a more terrible app than this? I haven’t seen a single positive review of this app! If this app is this bad I fear it will just harm my driving experience once it connects to my car. No thanks.

title: This app makes me want to buy not another Lexus ever again!
body: This app won’t even let me enter in a password to get into it.  I have deleted it and the old apps and tried to reinstall.  I’m not going to pay a fortune to have someone fix it for me the dealer.   Why change the app when it was working well before???

title: HORRIBLE
body: If I could give this feature 0 stars I would...you pay for a service and have to download an app that doesn’t work majority of the time...it’s useless! I’m at the point where I’m ready to get another vehicle where I don’t have to pay for a feature such as automatic start. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

title: Worst App Ever
body: Today, I’m cancelling my Lexus app. Woke up this morning there’s an internal error. First I’m asked to put my VIN in again. Once I get the information in, it says Internal error. Fed Up! Not to mention the days the dumb app does not work. It’s a waste of my time and money.

title: I dont know why?
body:
I dont know why people are complaining about the App?
Its working fine on GX 460 2021 from the first time.
All you need is to click on SOS, wait until they ask you a question then say “NO”, then say “Enroll”, they will send you an email with a number, you put in the App, and wait till the following day and it will work. The agent told me to drive it for 15 minutes first, but i didnt, and it worked by it self, her sound in the car was so clear, i felt she was sitting beside me.
The Tasks like starting the car or unlocking the door, or hazard, takes few seconds, its a car not a smart homekit gadget.
Thanks Lexus for making such a beautiful App/features.
But..... still upset that the GX460 is the ONLY car that doesnt support Apple car play! 4 Stars for that!

title: Needs works
body: App just needs work! You will get notifications even if your car is parked in your car (needs geofencing and white listing locations). Remote start with the fob only in you have a valid Lexus enform subscription and that goes away soon because of 3G (even for a 2017, RX350 FSport)

title: Horrible
body: I live in the Chicagoland area and we have brutally cold days. I try to warm the car which is parked in the garage and 90% of the time I receive an error that the app is “unable to locate the vehicle”. I have this service so I don't have to go running outside to warm the car but end up doing so almost every day.

title: Lexus Just Doesn’t Get It
body: I don’t want all of these “services” on my phone! I wish I could selectively choose some capabilities and bypass others. Toggling them on or off would make the program more meaningful. Lacking that choice I dumped the program.

title: Delay start
body: It takes 30 seconds for the car to start. This is useless for paying $175. And once it start the car shuts off. This is completely stupid!

title: Lexus app is not Lexus quality
body:
I hope at some point in the future Lexus will learn how to build a software application reflective of the quality of their vehicles. 
I hope they can look forward instead of looking thru the rear view mirror. 

Lexus IS good mechanically but when it comes to electronics the Germans have surpassed them. How could Lexus install 3G wireless radios in a 2018 vehicle knowing that the technology was moving towards 5G wireless. 5G wireless is not something that just appeared in 2020, but had been in standards working groups for a significant number of years. My 2019 LS doesn’t have USB C power connection. Please start looking forward.

title: Non-functioning 90% of the time
body:
1. Every time I use it, the screen doesnt update automatically. It shows you your last use of the app.

2. 90% of the time, it doesnt work. Keeps on “Connecting to Vehicle” until get irritated of waiting for it to say it has started.

3. No controls for temperature. You need to have the presence of mind to set it before you leave the car for your next auto start.

Ive had multiple after market auto starters before this. All works better than Lexus’s. Fix the dem app/connection issues. Even remembering the times it didnt work gets me frustrated.

title: Remote services stopped working

title: Not great, but getting better
body:
I have a few recommendations: 
1. Add remote start climate adjustments (allow the user to change the temp of the car from the app while a remote start is running). 
2. Add alarm sounded notification (if the alarm is sounded while the car is locked, allow the option to get an alert or even allow an option to setup an automated system to call you or text you).
3. Add the send destination to vehicle function to remote subscribers. This should be done for all vehicles that have the ability to have destination assist and that currently have remote subscription or trial. 

These features should be made to support a wide array of models, and should not be only for the newly refreshed ones.

title: Make Apple Watch App A “Complication”
body: Please make the Apple Watch app enabled as a watch “Complication” so it’s readily accessible from the watch face at all times.

Worst customer service

For over a week straight it didn’t work at all, now Lexus says I need to take to service for “update”. Six months into this car I already need what basically amounts to a day long update and a loaner car, that’s convenient...

title: Stopped working
body:
Update 1/7/2021:

Lexus helped find a fix:
1) Go to settings > general > storage
2) Find Lexus app, delete it 
3) Restart phone
4) Re-download Lexus app
5) Open app, then close it/shut it down 
6) Go to settings > Safari > privacy
7) Disable cookie blocker
8) Clear search history
9) Open Safari and open any website
10) Restart Lexus app and log in

I would have expected the app developer response to include these steps in their response. 

Original review:

The app suddenly stopped working. Perhaps after the last iOS update. Now it wants to open in a browser and the error message says “requires cookies to be enabled”, which I do have enabled. 
Without the app working, my (paid) Lexus Enform services can’t be used.

title: Should be more features
body: I have a 2020 Lexus NX and my app does not have features that a 2020 car app should have. I should be able to turn my car on and customize the heat/AC, seat warmers, Steering wheel heat etc... it’s useful to lock or unlock the car and check on the status of the car being locked or not but there should be more features...

title: Lexus App
body: You would think having a luxury car this app would allow you to control the inside of your car temperature... keep car running and lock it while you run in somewhere... it does not do any of that. Lexus should definitely update I mean even Toyota’s and Chrysler's have this feature.

title: Expected much more from Lexus
body:
I previously owned a Subaru that had much better app capability. When I “upgraded” to the Lexus, I expected to at least be able to do things I could do with the Subaru- not so. Simple quick things like seeing the tire pressure (the actual number) are either not present or not easy to navigate to in the app. 

I also can’t do things like set the radio or pop the trunk. It seems like the app should be able to communicate and let me do some of those things without sitting in the car and fiddling or fumbling with the fob.

I have a hybrid and would love some geek out info on my battery vs gas engine usage. How much gas have I saved overall? Which trips were my most efficient? Least? Any tips? 

The Apple Watch app is useless - don’t get me started on that.

Truly disappointed that they don’t seem to care at all about improving the app to raise it to the standard I expect from Lexus. Hybrid owners in particular I’d think would like more from the app.

title: Useless App
body: This app doesn’t even work. It keeps saying my VIN is wrong even though I’ve manually entered and copied and pasted it so many times. Yet, when I go on the mobile web version through safari it lets me log in magically.

title: Disappointed
body:
For this to be considered a luxury car I would expect a luxury app. For starters, I keep getting a notification and email that my subscription is ending and or registration didn’t  go through and will be cancelled soon. When I press the button in the car ( as instructed) they have no clue as to what I am referring too. 

To start my car, it will continue to circle until I get out of the not (not close ) and then MAYBE actually start the car , or not. Then god forbid you want to start it twice because ( it gets cold in upstate NY) you will have to actually close the app to try and start it again because , the start engine button is still spinning from the fist start . 

Same goes for locking and unlocking .

When it actually works and does what it’s supposed to do, I will change my score

This app charges you money to use your own personal data and track you everywhere so they can make money on you. Its extremely invasive and they really offer nothing of interest to me. Its a complete disregard of consumer privacy with user entitlements.  This app is a wasted effort, dont give them more of your money

pretty sure you can do better. Zero stars.

title: Total Fail....HOWEVER
body:
I’ve been trying for the past week to get my Lexus App  to accept my Lexus. Faxed in proof of ownership as instructed, but still no luck. After reading the excessively high number of complaints about the apparent ineffectiveness of the Lexus App, I’ve concluded that Lexus doesn’t want my $80 a yr subscription fee. 
As for the people writing vicious and nasty comments about Lexus. Yeah okay, you’re driving a high dollar car and you’re angry that your Lexus App is ineffective. To be brutally honest, you sound like a bunch of spoiled brats, whining and moaning about a stupid Lexus App that isn’t coddling you. Take a break from your childish anger and read a book about the Great Depression of 1929 or watch any number of YouTube videos on the same topic. People back then had truly suffered with very difficult living conditions with no money, little food, and no jobs.
They survived!  YOU don’t have it bad at all when you can complain about a stupid app which only serves to make us lazier. STOP WHINING. 
Thank you Lexus for building an awesome car, but a terrible app which I’ll never experience.
UPDATE: 12/23/20—A couple of days after this review, I tried adding my Lexus to this app again. Praise God! It worked.  I decided to test the waters and subscribed for a 30 day period. So far, the Lexus App has performed flawlessly. If you continue running as well as my beautiful and beloved Lexus, I may just keep you. Thank you Lexus App Developers for responding!

title: Embarrassing bad app
body:
Very poor developing on this app, they should just have kept the old one which always worked fine, it’s just embarrassing that GM and Fords are remote starting even without app just from the remote. It probably is all we want, be able to start it from about 100 feet away, but we can’t even have that out of a “high tech” brand. Sorry for the shame.

The technical support is very scarce if any, I have called 3 times and waisted 3 hours of my time trying to make it work with technical support that doesn’t know much and the ones that know “aren’t available” I can see how this brand might get in serious trouble, if they can’t even remote start a car, I don’t see how they will have a full electric car working. 

Shame on Lexus charging $160 a year for something that doesn’t even work!!

title: Remote start app flaw & clunky login
body:
Love my 2019 Lexus GX460, and the app is impressive, but the remote start app has a major flaw. It starts my car remotely but - it’s a pain for me when I load my family in, the car turns off as soon as I unlock the car. I’d expect the car to stay on once I, with my key, unlock the car. It might seem like a minor issue, but expected behavior of remote start cars is that the engine stays ON when the driver unlocks the car. Can this be fixed or changed so it’s easier?

Login is clunky on iOS. Every time I login I have to get a mobile access code. What’s going on?

Again, the app is impressive! Developers have done a great job.

title: Enform App  Sign In

At that time I was notified that I must install the NEW Enform app in order to use the service. I did so and have an aggravating issue ever since. 
I registered and checked “leave me signed in” but each time I open the app it requires me to sign in again!!! This is not convenient nor useful. I have called the customer service number twice and they tell me they must transfer me to a different dept. and each time my call has been dropped after waiting ion line for 5-10 minutes!!!
What is the problem with this app? Why cannot you correct it? And why does customer service not return calls they drop. You have all my contact information and require me to restate it when  my call is answered. I am very disappointed  with Lexus Enform service.

How about combining all these apps into one really useful app?

title: Lexus App & Related
body:
Although I generally like this app, which is mostly an improvement over the prior Enform app from Lexus, there’s an important missing feature that I consider a huge flaw.  That missing feature is driving my one star rating.   The prior Enform app could be used as a complication on the face of my Apple Watch.  That allowed me to quickly and easily start the car from my watch without ever bothering to reach for my phone.  This app can’t be used as a watch complication, and I consider that a huge inconvenience and oversight.  Hopefully that’s a problem that will be corrected very soon.  (This is a Lexus driven issue.  I checked with Apple.  Lexus has to give the app that functionality.)

To add insult to injury,  I’ve recently received a notice from Lexus advising that all of this app’s functionality (along with some other premium features) for my car are tied to 3G data networks.  Since those networks are being phased out, the functionality won’t even be available for my car in the not too distant future.  Seems like this was an oversight that could have and should have been avoided, or maybe it’s a case of intentional planned obsolescence to force people to buy new cars.  Hard to say with any certainty, either way, I’m not impressed.

When I combine these deficiencies with the poor controls to the Lexus infotainment system, which have been receiving universally bad reviews and ratings for years, I have to wonder what is going on at Lexus.  I usually don’t write reviews, good or bad,  but these latest and “greatest” updates have gotten me motivated enough to do so.

title: Absolute Mess
body:
I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience with my 2019 Lexus NX, apart from the terribly integrated Lexus Inform software. 
The software offers great features WHEN it works which is approximately 20% of the time in my experience. For example, I live in Colorado and love the remote start feature during the cold winter months. However I frequently have to attempt to start the car 3-4 times before it will actually go through. And sometimes it actually goes through, and says that it didn’t! 
But with the last update was the last straw for me. After downloading the update I was required to re-verify my vin number, which I did. The app loads the vin, correctly identifies my car, and then upon clicking save says errors that the information provided “does not match the records on file”, and tells me to CALL Lexus or to visit the dealership. 

As a software engineer myself, these kinds of bugs are absolutely unacceptable and will be the reason I choose a different make of vehicle with better software integration on my next purchase.

title: Frustrating
body: This app is both the most expensive and most frustrating to use, not good combination. The communication to vehicle to execute commands takes a long time and then you need to force close the app and reopen to execute a new command. Now today I had to re log into my account and my vehicle was not there and when I took the time to look up the vin and renter, it says it’s not linked.  Really frustrating especially after paying so much $ for the app to begin with.

title: Horrible app
body: Updated my remote app this evening. When I logged in it tells me to add my vehicle by scanning the VIN. When I scan it I get a pop up message that my information doesn’t match your records?  I guess I know I won’t be renewing my remote features next month.

it’s unbelievable you guys really got to figure out how to do upgrade seamlessly and cause drama and trauma to users I’m glad you’re not right in the code that runs the car This app is causing me a lot of trauma over four years I’ve seen it go through multiple versions and every time there’s an update something else goes wrong I just downloaded the most recent app and tried to get back into my car and it doesn’t recognize my van or me or my ID or anything it’s unbelievable you guys really got to figure out how to do upgraded seamlessly and not cause drama and trauma users I’m glad you’re not right in the code that runs the car

title: Updates break the app
body: What a horrible app. Half of the time it doesn’t connect to my vehicle. You have to send commands multiple times before they work. Takes too long to connect and execute what you’re trying to do (i.e. lock doors, remote start vehicle, etc.). The final kicker is you update the app and you lose all settings even though you’re registered to Lexus’ website. Settings should be stored in the cloud. Come on Lexus. title: Worked great for the first year, now I haven’t been able to use it for about 8 months

It’s gotten to the point where whenever I try to sign in, it will ask for my VIN. After that it tells me that I need to call Lexus as my “information doesn’t match our records”. I have contacted them on multiple occasions and they say its a known issue and that a fix is in the works. I have to admit that I’m frustrated that I pay for this service as it has become absolutely useless.

title: Bad
body: Just got a Lexus and was happy to hear about the app and it’s capabilities. The potential of this app is there but not executed. Every other time I attempt to enter it stalls and will not let me in. At other times it acts like I’ve never registered a vehicle or simply locks up. The Apple Watch component asks that I add a vehicle or tells me to connect via the phone app. The watch app tells me my fuel but will not start the vehicle and when I try it says there’s no vehicle connected. For Lexus to be such a luxury vehicle, this app gives your company a bad name. I should have tried this app out before I signed. Please fix your app for the watch (series 6) and iPhone 11 Pro Max. Also add features like virtual car keys through wallet like BMW has. Please don’t make me further regret my purchase and fix this. Your customers pay lots of money for high quality and this couldn’t be further from that.

title: What is the Point
body: The only thing I really NEED this app to do is allow me to start the vehicle remotely. The other things are interesting and “nice to have” but what I want for sure is remote start.  Now, it defeats the purpose of having an app if it forces me to manually sign in almost everyone I try to use it. And to make things worse, it sends me to a browser page to do it instead just letting the app handle the redundant login. If that is going to be required, why have an app on the first place?  Just send me to a webpage to start the car. Further, I do not need a notification to tell me to go check the app. If the system can send push notifications it should be able to tell me what the issue is in the initial notification like every other app I have ever used seems to be able to do.

title: Experience Amazing is what the Lexus tv commercial says

I should not be experiencing issues like this for the amount of money I am paying Lexus for my car and the perks that are offered.

NOT AMAZING!

title: Needs improvement

When I finally looked at the app I was shocked!! All high numbers! He used my fob and I didn’t sign him in as a guest. There’s no way to erase these high scores!!! I’m speaking of harsh turns, etc..I’m disappointed because I’m 68 years old and a very safe driver!!!

title: Does not stay logged in / forces me to create new password
body: It’s baffling how Lexus enform was working very well ... and every since I was forced to migrate to this app, I have only been successful in signing in once! I can log into my account with my credential via a website on a desktop just fine, but using this app, which reroutes to you a website to log in, it seems to ask for my email every time, verify my email with a code, and then create a NEW PASSWORD. Why? I can log into my account on the deskto, why do i need to create a new password? Also, once I am log in, it says the vin I’m trying to connect with my already linked account requires special attention, and call a phone number.

title: Extremely Frustrating
body: I purchased Enform through the app. First, I didn’t receive the activation or authorization code. Called SOS to help which led to tech support or whatever to reset the code. Finally got the app to do something. I was told to drive around for 15 minutes to link up all systems. After I drove for 15 minutes, the app magically refresh and I lost my subscription. I called support again, they don’t see my subscription so I had to resubscribe and repay for the subscription! In following, I ran into  “remote activation error”. Called support AGAIN and no one was able to help. A “ticket” was put in to see what the issue is and I won’t hear from Lexus until the next 3-5 days. This is bull and the most inconvenient technology. At this point, I just want a refund.

title: Not bad. However.....
body: Ok so the app isn’t bad. The restrictions you can put in place for certain driver profiles are pretty neat. It’s simple and not difficult to use. That being said it updates far too infrequent for me. If my teenager is out and I’m curious where the vehicle is parked because she hasn’t answered her phone. It can be pretty useless. Example. It’s 7:30 and the vehicle was last updated around 4pm when I was in another town. If it could store activity for the day that would be great. The app is not bad at all. However not sure if all the features are worth the money since it doesn’t update frequently. The connecting speed is great. When you lock or start the car. Doesn’t take long at all. That aspect is great. I hope this gets worked on. Definitely something I’ll consider on my next vehicle. Everything is wireless now. Kind of a big deal.

title: Terrible app
body: This has to be the worst app ever!!!! I’ve had my car since February and this app at best works maybe 50% of the time. It’s infuriating to say the least. It does not connect to my vehicle so I can remotely start, only on some rare occasions. The last time it supposedly connected was 15 days ago. The most consistent thing that it monitors is the most recent trip, every thing else is off. They need to give this app a complete overhaul. The previous app worked more consistently on my last car. Not a happy customer. Probably won’t be paying for it after the trial period.

title: Open door after remote start kills engine. Doesn’t indicate door lock status
body: The remote starter works. However as soon as open door or hatch kills the engine. Poor system integration and usability. In summer heat want AC to continue running while settle in. In winter when open hatch to get scraper want defroster to keep running while scrape snow off...Then minor inconveniences. No door lock status indicator. So press Lock takes 30 sec then tells me doors are locked...The worst was wouldn’t login many times at first. Tries to start a website to login. Poor design. Should use REST API and display a usable error message instead of relying on the browser displaying a generic useless HTTP error. Violates basic CS101 usability. I finally figured out required cookies enabled on Safari. So after wasting several hours was able to use it.

title: Terrible

Bye!

title: New App- still not working

title: Great When It Works
body: I really like the idea of being able to lock/unlock and start my car remotely.  It’s really handy if I forgot something and Don’t have my key handy or if I want the heat or AC to run before I get into the car.  However, the app only works maybe 1/10 times.  The first time I brought it to the dealership and they reset everything and it worked... for about a week.  Now it’s 1/10 times if I’m lucky.

title: Junk App
body:
More Lexus junk. 
This app was thought up by 20 something idiot.  Are there any adults at Lexus?

title: Yearly subscription of $160 expensive
body: The most useful feature of this app is remote lock/unlock and starting the engine. Vehicle health is useful as well. Paying $160 a year for them is way too expensive and not worth it! Tesla has a better app and it’s free.

title: Slow and unreliable- why do I have to PAY for this
body: This app is continually glitchy slow and unreliable. I don’t understand why this type of service is free with my Ford vehicles but I have to pay for it with my luxury vehicle. Not a great customer experience Lexus s!!!

title: Still trying to get AP working after FIVE WEEKS.
body:
I’ve called Lexus customer service multiple times. Always another story to get me off the phone. I’ve heard “service is out wait a week”, “wait two days then just hit the SOS button” and “wait 24 hours and refresh”. Nothing has worked. Pathetic. I can’t believe LEXUS management allows this situation to exist. I looked through the reviews and am shocked.

UPDATE 

Called Lexus App support AGAIN. Now they are telling me to take it to the dealer. They seem to think it’s a hardware issue which I seriously doubt given the in-car to Lexus (SOS) communication device works but asks for a PIN # to activate. I spoke briefly to the service manager at the dealer and he seemed very competent. Time will tell. 

I’m seriously rethinking my next vehicle purchase.

title: What’s the point
body: I took delivery of a 2020 Lexus ES 350 on 4/21/20.  While there, my sales person set up the Lexus Enform system and had me download this app.  It has not worked correctly from the very beginning.  At first, I could see my odometer reading, my miles to empty and if my doors were closed and locked.  I’ve never been able to lock or unlock the doors, nor start the engine.  It’s now showing my last update to be 7/21/20, and my last recorded parking spot is from 7/24/20.  I’ve spoken with the dealership and was first told I would need to bring the car back in and they’d need it for a few hours to do a software upgrade or something like that.  I decided to wait as we were leaving on vacation.  When we got back I called and spoke to my dealerships IT guy and arranged to bring my car in.  All he did was essentially everything I had tried and he confirmed that, yeah, it’s not working.  He supposedly sent my issue up to Lexus or whomever, and that’s been a few weeks ago.  Still no resolution, still not working correctly.  Thus the title of this review.

title: Money WASTED on Enform Subscription
body: I have not been able to use the Enform app since the update to this new, “improved” app. It’s been MONTHS now. I now continually get the “VIN cannot be authenticated” and the app cannot be used. Multiple calls over the last few months to customer service and it’s STILL not fixed. Lexus should be ashamed of this app.

title: App is a JOKE
body: I am now driving my 6th Lexus. This time I thought I’d enroll in Lexus Enform and use the Lexus App.  Everyone at Enform was “helpful” but after an hour and a half of trying multiple approaches I could not even log into the app. I am not an IOS novice and I have never experienced anything like this with any other app.  My recommendation to Lexus is to stick to cars or make the investment in a NEW app that lives up to the standard you’ve set for your cars.  The app should enhance the Lexus experience, not diminish it.  My recommendation to you if you’re considering this app: DON’T use it.

title: This new app is terrible
body: I had a remote app and when opening the app it told me it was being replaced on September 8th and to download this as replacement. I did that and this app has no remote start capability and is terrible.

title: Never worked for me
body: I was super excited to know of this app and to be able to remotely start my car, so that it was able to be cooled off prior to me getting in. I live in FL and this summer heat is serious. Anyway, I have NOT been able to ever get my car started remotely. Is it just me? If so, what am I doing wrong?

title: Not intuitive
body: Have been successfully using the previous app. Told the same thing as in other reviews that it was expiring so I downloaded this one and found it to be not intuitive. Some of it had to do with my human error so I updated my review. Hope to be able to make it easier for use.

title: Terrible down grade
body: What is the point of this “upgrade”? I pay a premium for the ease of locking/unlocking and remote starting my GX460. I can not figure out how to do these basic things in the new app. This is simply an advertising platform that I have the “luxury” of paying a premium for. The old app while not perfect added value and was user friendly. This is none of those. Maintentance.... advertising. Sirius.... advertising.... Vehicle status who cares if you can’t manage from the app. What a waste.

title: Apple Watch complication?
body: Updated from 1 to 4 stars. Much better than several months ago. How can I add a complication to the Apple Watch? Is that something I’m missing or are you working on it? I still have the old app installed because not all features are present in the new app. But work in progress I suppose. Pleased with the improvement, but still disappointed Lexus customers were basically beta testers for this app.

title: Unusable
body: Keep trying to register but it keeps telling me the trial period is over.  Very amateurish app.

title: Worse app
body: This app is worthless, the Enform was so much better. After the last update it’s even worse. It doesn’t show the mileage, the miles until empty, it also doesn’t show last trip, parking or your score. Hard to believe Lexus doesn’t have a better app

title: Updates
body: The app has poor functionality, do you guys test the app before launching an update? If you could provide more details in the description of the update as well that’d be appreciated so we know what bugs have and haven’t been fixed cause it just seems like the app gets slower every week you push an update.

title: Horrible app
body: Bought a 2020 es 350 the dealership say the app and my I phone 11 is not compatible so when I cut the car on my Apple Music goes down and the comes up loud. Come on Lexus that’s the best you can do for all the money I Pay for this car

title: Remote services do not work at all
body:
Paying for the remote services and I can’t even use it. The dashboard has said “remote activation pending, can take up to 24 hours” for two weeks now. Worked fine on the original app, ever since I was forced to switch I can’t use the service I’m paying for. I will be requesting a refund on my paid remote services because I can’t use them.

Update: pressing the SOS button in my car did nothing for connecting to the app. I am still unable to connect my car to the app and use the remote services. Judging by the vast quantity of 1-2 star reviews, it’s pretty obvious the app needs a ton of work.

title: Car image not displayed.
body: A month ago, the app showed the image of my car (2015 IS) and after the most recent updates the apps says “Image Not Found”. This has happened with previous updates where the image is displayed then after an update, it’s gone. Not like my car is a 1990 either.

title: Works sporadically
body: I would love if the remote start worked every time I need it! Very frustrating when I have to continually press start and nothing happens.

title: Feature Missing
body: Please add back the feature where the password is required before using any of the functions.

title: Useless unless you pay $240/year
body: You don’t need this app. It’s useless unless you pay up to $240/ year for the services. Someone at Lexus needs to rethink the price pony on this. I don’t pay that much for Office 365 and I use that every day.

title: New App not visible to use remote starter
body: The app doesn’t allow you to use your remote starter. I am paying for something and receiving the benefits of!

title: No improvement
body: Previous app you could use 4 number code to access. Not available in this

title: What’s up???
body: Where is all the Enform car data that we had with the prior app?

title: Very Slow Response
body:
The app does work but there needs to be a notation telling users that only one set of credentials like email address and phone can be registered to a VIN. This would facilitate setup for multiple drivers and cellphones. 

We can lock/unlock and start the car remotely but the status updates can take up to two minutes. I unlocked the car remotely and tried to start it remotely - which is not allowed by the app. So I locked the car remotely and watched the mirrors on our NX fold in a few seconds, but I had to sit on my hands for two minutes waiting for “unlocked” to disappear from the status screen before the “Start” instruction timed out and offered to lock the car for me - when it was already locked. Multiple active processes need to better communicate. 

The app is sluggish at best which marginalizes the utility of having the remote app to begin with. Please consider significantly increasing responsiveness when next updating the remote app - with thanks in advance for doing so.

title: Good until it failed me!
body: I can’t give it more than one star simply because thieves were able to get into my vehicle and steal my belongings and the app literally did nothing to notify me of this. The day I needed that notification more than any other day it simply failed me 😡

title: Regret
body: Maybe I should’ve read the reviews before actually paying but I figured, hey it’s a Lexus, what could go wrong. It seems EVERYTHING! Been on the phone almost all day to get it fixed but to no avail. I am only paying to use the remote service. It doesn’t give me a fuel update or mileage either. How can a company pride themself on quality and customer satisfaction but cannot hire competent people to solve a simple software issue in today’s time. FIX IT!!!

title: Not a good app
body: I put my VIN # as requested.  I was told that they don’t recognize the #.  I was advised to call some one  I can’t be bothered.  Many things can be cured, but not STUPIDITY!

title: Why buy this??
body:
I have had this for almost a year now.  Frankly, it's not very good.  My wife has a remote that starts her car very quickly while I have to wait some 15-20 seconds for this to work.  Buy the time I have to wait I am close to the car.  I can't believe they actually CHARGE for this awful app.  Now I get a notice there is a new more functional app but it doesn't work with the RX.  I keep getting the notice but what do I care since I actually have an RX.  I suspectt will take Lexus 5
Years to work with Apple to get their car app from iOS14 to work.  I left BMW to try a Lexus.  It's a good car but their internet support, like this app, needs t catch up with the world.

title: Great app
body: Much better than the previous one

title: Why
body: This updated? app is worse than the one it replaced. Using my Apple Watch app it keeps telling me to login with my phone. I am always logged in with my phone.

title: Not responsive
body: These apps aren’t always the most reliable. Hard to justify the cost of the heart service. All it tells you is where the car is, or at best its last location hours ago, which is not even where it really is. Hard to get a good connection to get it to get a status update. Wish it was better after the first Enform app, don’t think I’ll renew the next year. I hardly use it.

title: Safety notification not working
body: The old App worked perfectly but this one just terrible every day needed apdate just for receive safety notification

title: App does not work
body: App will not allow user to renewal expired subscription as advertised

title: Remote start doesn’t work
body: Shows all the status of the 2020 ES, fuel distance etc but won’t start it from the house  Notification on, as req   The key fob does start remotely. Old app always worked

title: Truly Doesn’t Work
body: Every now and then I can get the remote features to work.  Generally, I can stand directly next to my car and can’t even get the app to lock it.  Disappointing.

title: Please add a vehicle
body: The new app is still worse than the old version. The watch app hardly ever works on the first try, always saying “please add a vehicle”... The phone app shows the car just fine when I open it. Does anyone test these apps?

title: New Enform app
body: Every time I want to use it, it says I have to download it again. Bad app.

title: Crashing
body: This new update on iOS 12.4.1 is an embarrassment for a supposed upscale car maker. The odometer, fuel status, and miles to empty no longer show up, and crashing occurs at random. Please fix.

title: Update make app stop working
body:
Was hoping with this new app that when they did updates it would make app stop working properly.  But not the case. As with older apps when updates happen app doesn’t work properly. 

Not impressive for Lexus and Toyota.

title: Worked great until it didn’t
body:
Bought my Lexus in April 2020 and I absolutely love it. Set up the app, was kind of a pain but once set up was awesome! Worked through May and stopped working in June. Have called multiple times and have received zero help, just that they are “working on it”. 
Pretty awesome I paid $80 for the year for remote start that hasn’t worked for longer than it actually worked.
Get it together, you should be embarrassed that this app is out in the world right now.

title: Not functional
body: Remote start & lock/unlock features have yet to work

title: Confused
body: I have so many Lexus icons on my phone I don’t know which is which and for what they are used

title: Useless Garbage
body: This app is useless.  First of all after I paid for my subscription the app kept saying I had no active subscription.  Contacted customer support who just basically said they are having issues and don’t know when it will be back up.  It’s been about a month and I still can’t add my vehicle

title: Remote doesn’t work
body:
I bought a 2020 Lexus UX250h a month ago. I was supposed to get three years of the remote services, but nothing works. Can’t start car or lock/unlock doors. Calls to the dealer are unreturned, and can’t get customer service from Lexus. The car is fine, though.
UPDATE- got through to customer service, and they tried to reset app several times, to no avail. So they said I had to go to the dealer to have my car reprogrammed. I spent half a day with the dealer , which was a total waste of time. After the dealer supposedly did something, they also reset the app again. I went home while waiting for the app to reset, only to find it STILL DOESN’T WORK. This is my third Lexus, but likely my last.

title: It NEVER works
body: If I could do -1 stars I would!!!!! It literally NEVER works...I feel like this app waisted my time and I feel like Lexus ripped me off assuring me of a remote start feature that only worked for a few weeks after purchase.

title: App needs serious work
body: I have. 2020 ES F Sport. This has has basically no functionality except how fuel I have. Won’t remote start the car, won’t lock/unlock, no parking update on the map. It’s pretty useless. Expected so much more from Lexus!

title: Not fully functioning
body: I just got a new ES350. Connected to this app. It shows my image and gas remaining. But I can’t connect to lock and unlock the car. It keep showing that all doors are unlocked even thou that is not true. Don’t know what else to do to fix this.

title: Confused...
body: I purchased my NX in 2017 and absolutely love my Lexus. I received the free app service and decided to continue with PAID service since the day the free service expired. Now that the original enform app I was using has been removed I have not been able to access the new app. The app will not allow me to add my VIN and log in. I’ve called customer service “three” times now and have been told the “minor” bugs are being fixed to just give it another week or so. Well it’s now been a few months. How are you able to get away with charging for a service that is not accessible? I love my Lexus and the Lexus service in house. This app is not functioning and you are now stealing from me and providing answers. Extremely unhappy with this service.

title: It doesn’t work
body: The app and lexus customer service are both useless

title: Disaster
body: We have 2 IS300s, a 2016 and a 2019. Over the past couple of weeks both updated the head unit software to add Alexa. I updated both this app and the Enform app on my iPhone X in response. Since doing that a) the paid Enform subscriptions on both cars have been cancelled (received a credit to my credit card already). And the telematics have been shut down entirely on the 2016 according to the Waiver agreement and emails I received. Puzzled, I didn’t ask for any of this. Not really sure what’s going on here, if Lexus messed up or I did something wrong when installing the new app. But, doesn’t seem worth the risk.

title: Non-functioning app
body: Why have an app that takes forever to respond! The new app version did not turn off my car after the app finally connected and gave me a message my car had been shut off. Went outside to make sure and it was still running.   App is cumbersome and If I finally get to log in to start my car, I’m already at the car. Why bother using the app. Lexus really lags behind on technology. Why can’t you start the car by using the key fob like other competitors do?

title: For the Lexus app
body: Seamless use ability for upgrades styles colors overall was able to experience lifelike excitement as if I’ve been at the show room floor just at the touch of my phone. All the information was relevant to my exact character as if the app was talking to me personally as I scrolled through all the options  and acquired the different information is to build the car and I love.. with so many choices but yet pinpointed the mindset inspired my exact character.The developer of these cars and apps are truly a class and technology out there in their own time and space

title: Constant Log-In
body:
After setting up a log-in and Face ID
the app should be easy to use. Trying to use remote start is hampered by asking me to log in for security purposes. I should not have to do this repeatedly especially when it’s hot and I’m trying to cool off the car. Why not just trust Face ID? I don’t need this much security. This app should work each time with no issues.

title: Messed up new version
body:
I have two Lexus rx350 /2019. Before the update,  I was able to have both cars information on the same app and was able to switch them to start and use other Options and see status.
My wife had the same app on her phone with the same ability to start cars remotely or see the status on both my phone or her phone.
Since updating these options are not available on either phones.
My call to Lexus made it worse .
Is it possible to let we have the previous version of this app?

title: No access after Update
body: I had access prior to the latest update. Now, since the latest update, it’s been two weeks and counting of not being able to do anything in the app.

title: Update lacking
body: I value finding my parked car. I am missing being able to check navigation which I truly valued as a service in knowing family members were making expected progress on medical appointments etc. I would go back if I could.

title: What is going on Lexus
body: I buy apps all the time but I hate paying for subscriptions.  I folded on this app and now I ask myself why each day.  The credibility of the data is strange to say the least...and sends me in circles.  e.g. notification that the door is unlocked.  OK push the button to lock it...after running circles for a while it reports that it is unable to lock the doors.  I go to the car and it is locked.  I manually open close and lock all the doors.  Same message.  Then the message to change the app.  OK.  I update to the new app.  Now it wants to send me a verification code that never comes.  Closed the app.  Upon opening the app again, it sends me to update the app again.  Now it repeated the whole stupid cycle again.  So the only use of this app is to waste my time.  The inconvenience and frustration comes at a high subscription cost.  Get you act together Lexus.  My previous Lexus was a dream.  I see now it was to be a one shot dream.  I made a lot of compromises to stay with Lexus.  Now I know it was not wise.  I am so sad that I can no longer recommend Lexus.  Do better Lexus!

title: I’m disappointed
body: 2018 GS 350 F Sport keeping indicating that my doors are unlocked which isn’t the case. I can’t use the app, because of the errors that I am receiving. I shouldn’t have to pay for this app when other vehicle manufacturers have remote start for FREE!
